comment.author: 41675580@N08
comment._content: That must have been quite a wallop, it's given her a mouth!

comment.author: 87799065@N02
comment._content: My dad was on board, the ships doctor from the KGV transferred to the Punjabi to "see more action", he was one of those lost following the collision. The depth charges were set to minimal depth in expectation of a U Boat attack, they exploded killing many of those who had managed to escape the sinking stern quarter. Dad said that on the KGV they "barely" felt the collision.
